result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelly Scott Steinert

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Selmer. Corrected. arc    to KP
Filed by Atty Selmer. arc   to kp

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license. 

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

1:20 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Kelly Scott Steinert in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Kelly Scott Steinert.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE confirms address.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy prelim, State to provide discovery before next hearing. Adjourned at 1:44 PM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
